Dear Ms. Thomas:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 5, 2019. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
rule.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and
shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(f) A record of any convictions other than minor traffic
violations from either of the following entities:
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or the
equivalent state law enforcement agency, Canadian
province, or other country where the person usually
resides or has resided in the previous 5 years.
In 2019, one of six employees transferred into the residential
program from another program in the agency.
Her ICHAT was dated 2017. A new ICHAT should have been
run when the employee was transferred in 2019.
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
(a) – (i)
Initial documentation was not completed when a resident
discharged from short-term was admitted to the treatment
program. (One of two)
(Repeat Violation)
1

R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and date
an updated treatment plan for each resident at least once
every 90-calendar days following the initial treatment
plan.
One of one closed treatment resident was missing an
updated treatment plan. No plan was completed for the last
ten weeks of her stay.
2.) ISEP requirements do not apply to this facility as they do not accept minors from the
foster care or juvenile justice systems.
3.) This facility contracts with the Children’s Services Agency. This report will be
forwarded to Housing Specialist Megan Bolonga.
IV. CONSULTATION
It was suggested the orientation sheet for direct care workers be revised to describe in
detail how staff are oriented to their duties by their supervisor outside of or in addition to
shadowing other staff for three days.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility submitted one acceptable corrective action plan unrelated to
maltreatment for the Renewal in 2018. R 400.4152 Initial documentation was
cited. The CAP involved revising the intake form.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
2

acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on their
regular license.
